content: Singaporean former admiral **Lai Chung Han** [PPA(P)](/wiki/Pingat_Pentadbiran_Awam_(Tentera)) is a Singaporean civil servant and former two-star [rear-admiral](/wiki/Rear-admiral) who served as [Chief of Navy](/wiki/Chief_of_Navy_(Singapore)) between 2014 and 2017. ## Education Lai was awarded the [President's Scholarship](/wiki/President%27s_Scholar) and [Singapore Armed Forces Overseas Scholarship](/wiki/Singapore_Armed_Forces_Overseas_Scholarship) in 1992. He graduated from [Christ's College, Cambridge](/wiki/Christ%27s_College,_Cambridge) with a [Bachelor of Arts](/wiki/Bachelor_of_Arts) with first class honours degree in [economics](/wiki/Economics). He received the Singapore Armed Forces Overseas Postgraduate Scholarship (General Development) in 2006, before going on to complete a [Master of Public Administration](/wiki/Master_of_Public_Administration) degree at [Harvard University](/wiki/Harvard_University). He also attended the [Naval War College](/wiki/Naval_War_College) in the United States. ## Military career Lai enlisted in the [Singapore Armed Forces](/wiki/Singapore_Armed_Forces) (SAF) in 1992 and served in the [Republic of Singapore Navy](/wiki/Republic_of_Singapore_Navy) (RSN). He served on board the RSS *Valour* as a junior officer and later as Executive Officer before assuming command of the RSS *Valiant* from 2002 to 2004. He was appointed as Commander of the Missile Corvette Squadron in July 2007 and later Fleet Commander in April 2011. Lai has also held a number of staff appointments concurrently in the headquarters of the [Ministry of Defence](/wiki/Ministry_of_Defence_(Singapore)) (MINDEF), this include: Head of Long Term Planning Secretariat, Office of the Chief of Defence Force; Office Director, Future Systems Directorate; Director (Policy), Ministry of Defence (2007–2010); Deputy Secretary (Policy), Ministry of Defence (2012–2014). Lai was promoted to the rank two-star [rear-admiral](/wiki/Rear-admiral) on 1 July 2014. He succeeded [Ng Chee Peng](/wiki/Ng_Chee_Peng) as Chief of Navy on 1 August 2014. Lai stepped down as Chief of Navy with Rear-Admiral [Lew Chuen Hong](/wiki/Lew_Chuen_Hong), previously Chief of Staff – Naval Staff, taking over the command on Change of Command Parade held at [RSS Singapura – Changi Naval Base](/wiki/Changi_Naval_Base) on 16 June 2017. ## Civil Service career Lai was formerly a member of the board of ST Marine and [ST Electronics (Info-Comm Systems)](/wiki/ST_Engineering) and a member of the Board of Governors of [Temasek Polytechnic](/wiki/Temasek_Polytechnic). Lai was appointed [Second Permanent Secretary for Education](/wiki/Ministry_of_Education_(Singapore)) on 19 June 2017, and [Second Permanent Secretary for Home Affairs](/wiki/Ministry_of_Home_Affairs_(Singapore)) on 1 September 2017, concurrently. On 1 April 2019, Lai relinquished both appointments before being appointed Permanent Secretary for Education. ## Personal life Lai is married to Ng Chiew Yen and they have two children. ## Awards Lai was awarded the [Public Administration Medal (Silver) (Military)](/wiki/Pingat_Pentadbiran_Awam_(Tentera)) in 2010.
